definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
worthy of pride/impressive/enviable/to show contempt for others
to guard against pride and impatience (idiom); to remain modest and keep cool
lit. an arrogant army is bound to lose (idiom)/fig. pride goes before a fall
no arrogance in victory, no despair in defeat
pinyin: sheng4 bu4 jiao1 , bai4 bu4 nei3

definition: Modesty leads to progress, arrogance makes you drop behind (favorite slogan of Mao Zedong)
pinyin: xu1 xin1 shi3 ren2 jin4 bu4 , jiao1 ao4 shi3 ren2 luo4 hou4
containing_words.word: 虛心使人進步，驕傲使人落後

definition: variant of 驕奢淫逸|骄奢淫逸[jiao1 she1 yin2 yi4]

sentences.english: When a general meets a worthy opponent, he won't dare to underestimate him.
sentences.chinese: 棋逢對手難相勝，將遇良才不敢驕。

sentences.english: I know better than to be proud and demanding.
sentences.chinese: 不過我很明白識體，不至於會縱驕，也不會苛求。

sentences.english: Today, I babysat my neighbour's spoilt bratty twins.
sentences.chinese: 今天我照看鄰居家驕慣壞了的雙胞胎。

sentences.english: Building Shangrao as a proud and civilization land.
sentences.chinese: 把發展的上饒建設得更加文明多驕。

definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
warp (the vertical threads in weaving)/vertical/longitudinal/north-south (lines of longitude)/lengthwise/to release/to indulge/even if
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
distinguished and accomplished/outstanding/talented in letters and unconventional in lifestyle/romantic/dissolute/loose
